intro: Ixeris serotina, commonly known as late yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes and stream banks. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer to early fall, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Ixeris serotina is often found in wetlands and is an important part of the local ecosystem.
